sentences.sContent: She fell heavily, striking her head against the side of the boat.
sentences.sCn: 她重重地摔倒，头撞在船舷上。

sentences.sContent: A snowball struck him on the back of the head.
sentences.sCn: 一个雪球打中了他的后脑勺。

sentences.sContent: Several cars were struck by falling trees.
sentences.sCn: 几辆车被倒下的树砸中。

sentences.sContent: The last rays of the setting sun struck the windows.
sentences.sCn: 落日的最后一缕阳光照在窗户上。

synos.tran: 打，打击；[劳经]罢工；敲，敲击；抓；打动；穿透
打，击；[劳经]罢工；撞击，冲击；侵袭；打动；到达

phrases.pCn: n. 雷击（等于lightning stroke）；闪电式罢工
打动(某人的)心弦，在(某人心中)引起共鸣
使开始；建立起；开始演奏
获得最大成就；达到最高目标；显出全副本领

words.tran: 显著的，突出的，惊人的；打击的；罢工的
罢工者；打击者；[军] 撞针；钟锤；叉鱼的人
罢工，打，打击（strike的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 罢工；打，击，敲；袭击，侵袭；敲响，报时
trans.tranOther: to hit or fall against the surface of something

trans.tranCn: 使突然想到；打，击，敲；侵袭，折磨；给…以深刻印象；发现，找到
trans.tranOther: to hit or fall against the surface of something
a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc
